reviews.review_msg: I don't think he knows C from COBOL.  This guy clearly doesn't like to teach and doesn't care about his students.
Not a good instructor at all.

Amir is an exceptional professor who deeply cares about his students. He brings energy and humor to class while thoroughly covering the material. Attending lectures is crucial, especially if you're new to coding, as each session builds on the last. Falling behind makes catching up challenging, so stay engaged and present.

Solid choice. Course content was helpful to get introduced to mysql. Assignments and homework connected directly to the course content and provided hands on experience. Classes were interesting and interactive. Exams weren't too hard but challenging. Would recommend him for the course.

Took course in summer 2020, absolute joy to work with and is very engaging. Easier if you have some programming experience, but course is manageable for non-experienced. Be ready to be creative with your SQL queries, some fairly hard questions, and w3schools will be your best friend.

Didnt know SQL til I took 464 with him. Learned a ton, and classes were very engaging and fun. Hes so funny, you wont expect that his exams would be tough haha, so be prepared! But if you study hard, practice lots, answer bonus questions and ask him questions when lost, youll be just fine. He tries his best to motivate students, a real gem!

Amir is a good instructor. Hes worked for Microsoft and google for many years and has a ton of work experience. Thanks to him Ive gained a lot of experience that I can transfer in the MIS field. Hard exams, make sure you prepare. Total jokester too, quite personable.

Quizzes and assignments were quite difficult overall. Weekly quizzes are tricky - questions have multiple answers. Weekly assignments are difficult, but you get a partner - lecture notes don't really prepare you for them. Entire course has a ton of content, you'll fall behind really easily if you don't try hard to be on pace.
Enjoyable class but more should have been taught, I think. It didn't feel like it was taught at the 400 level.
Love Daniel. Super passionate, accessible, and helpful. The material itself is also pretty practical and useful.

Daniel is brilliant, funny and great at teaching . He is extremely passionate about all things IT and is almost always available to help out. Do your readings, come prepared for class and ask him questions - he will have an answer for you! He is definitely one of my favourite professors at SFU and I would 100% take another class with him.

Loved this class! Teaches you how to create a database, website, and connect everything together into a working business application. Focus on website content rather than style (CSS), and very helpful with debugging. Places larger value on proper coding rather than the user interface but you can take a design class for that.

Aish does not know how to teach and when you asked him for help he would scold you and say that you haven't been spending enough time studying. His assignments & tests are extremely challenging and his thick accent makes it very hard to understand him. He often shows that he's annoyed or frustrated to the class when the class doesn't participate.

I wouldn't say Aish is an amazing one during lectures, but he was really accessible and always willing to help students by hosting as many office hours as he can. Course materials aren't hard, but you need to take time to understand and practice a lot. You will choose your own teammate so be wise on that. Project is hard but you will learn SO much.

Aishwarya is a helpful and caring professor who prioritizes student feedback. Course concepts may be tricky for those without a technical background, but he goes the extra mile to help students outside of class and will tell us what to study for the exams. Take really good lecture/textbook notes for final, practice quizzes, and write a lot of code.
I would take this instructor again. he was helpful and available feedback outside class when needed. And he really wanted his students to understand what he was teaching.

he is a fantastic prof who really cares about his students. the course is very helpful. there are a few assignments that are very difficult and time consuming but he is available to help you. if you have a good partner, you will do well, if not, good luck because there are no peer evaluations. lectures are heavy and exams are fair.

He's a caring prof who is almost always available for help after class. His assignments are difficult but you learn a lot. Picking a good partner for the assignments is crucial because you're stuck with them for the whole term. There's no peer evaluation but there should be to stop freeloaders.

Aishwarya is smart and passionate about this course but he cannot teach. His lectures were very dry and he has a thick accent so its difficult to understand him. When hes asking a question, no one participates b/c we dont know what hes saying so gets frustrated. He tells us to email him if we have any questions but does not reply.

Difficulty of this class is not because of content. Its whether you had a hardworking partner. I had an amazing partner so assignments were not hard. Exams are fair. Overall one of the only classes Ive learned something applicable for a job. Good professor I would recommend.

A good prof overall, very open to suggestions and caring towards his students. Lectures are very content-heavy and exams are not easy but that is the norm with these types of courses. Make sure to stay up to date with lectures because lots is covered each time.

He gives difficult assignments but they're extremely applicable. He cares a lot about his students and is available to help after class or during office hours. Definitely one of the most useful classes I have taken!

Aishwarya is a great prof for a coding class. His assignments are TOUGH but will help you learn. He is always available during office hours to help you with assignments or questions which is great. He is also very caring about you personally and has been amazing during the covid19 situation. I would recommend taking him for BUS464.
Really enjoyed his class! The course itself was though, but he was passionate about the topics, which makes it interesting. Overall, great prof!

Prof. Aish is very caring towards his students. Although his assignment is pretty difficult, he was really helpful and accessible outside the lecture if you have any questions. He appreciates those who work hard for the course. I would definitely recommend taking this course with him.

Aishwarya is caring, knowledgeable, and wants all students to learn. When classes do not participate, he gets visibly frustrated. He would do well to shift his teaching style from simply "asking a question and waiting for a response" to repeating his question differently, or walking students simply through logic to derive the answer.

Very helpful and kind professor. He really cares about his students and will take the time to explain concepts thoroughly if he feels people don't understand. This was one of the most useful and interesting courses I took and favorite prof!!
